answerText: RuBisCO [accept Ribulose-1,5-bisphosphate carboxylase/oxygenase][10] Rubisco is used as a catalyst in these light independent reactions, which take place in the stroma of chloroplasts. It takes carbon dioxide and turns it into sugar and helps prevent photorespiration.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of Pittsburgh A and Walter Johnson High School | 20 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Recent research has attempted to replace this enzyme in tobacco with Rhodospirillum rubrum. [10] Name this enzyme, the most abundant on Earth, which performs the rate-determining step of carbon fixation.
